#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk spice-debuginfo
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: spice bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The Simple Protocol for Independent Computing Environments (SPICE) is a remote display system built for virtual environments which allows the user to view a computing 'desktop' environment not only on the machine where it is running, but from anywhere on the Internet and from a wide variety of machine architectures. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, an infinite loop in some cases triggered in the SPICE server on long-running virtual machines (VMs). As a consequence, SPICE sessions on the affected server became unresponsive. With this update, 64-bit timer values are now used for the appropriate SPICE sessions, and the described infinite loops no longer occur. (BZ#1227408) When encrypting the SPICE connection password while booting in FIPS mode, SPICE previously attempted to use a weak encryption method. Consequently, the encryption failed and QEMU terminated unexpectedly. This update adjusts SPICE to requires Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) authentication when using FIPS, which prevents the described crash from occurring. (BZ#1071176) Prior to this update, Microsoft Windows guests with multi-monitor setup in some cases waited for an image that had already been deleted, which caused the client to become unresponsive. With this update, reference counting has been added to channel images in the client and thread safety has been improved for image caching in the server. As a result, Windows guests no longer hang due to the mentioned reasons. (BZ#1235443) Users of spice are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
